did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Letters, photographs, clippings, printed materials, and ephemera.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Materials relating to Oliver C. Winston's work in Washington, D.C., Baltimore, Binghamton and Cornell University.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: City planner. Oliver C. Winston held a B.A. and B.S. in architecture from The Rice Institute. He worked for the Housing Division of the Public Works Administration in Washington from 1934 to 1938; was Regional Director of the United States Housing Authority in Washington, 1939-1947; was Executive Director of the Housing Authority of Baltimore City, Urban Renewal Coordinator for Baltimore City, and Director of Baltimore Urban Renewal and Housing Agency. He later served in planning positions in Binghamton, New York and at the Office of Regional Resources and Development at Cornell University. Winston died on April 25, 1992 at the age of 86.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Biographical material including photographs and early correspondence; Correspondence, appointments, notes, lectures, speeches, conferences and seminars relating to his work in Washington, D.C. as well as files relating to his work in Baltimore and Binghamton; and teaching and department files relating to his work at Cornell University.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Winston C. Oliver Papers#4408. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p: Material relating to Winston's private practice of architecture in Houston, Texas, 1927-1934. Chiefly correspondence and studies, plans, etc. for projects undertaken by his firm. Includes resumes and biographical information.

Material pertaining to Winston's positions in Washington, D.C. as Project Planner for Housing, Division of Public Works Administration (1934-1938) and Regional Director of the United States Housing Authority (1939-1947)

Covers Winston's positions as Executive Director of the Housing Authority of Baltimore City (1947-1959), Director of the Baltimore Urban Renewal and Housing Agency (1957-1959), and Urban Renewal Coordinator for Baltimore City (1955-1956). Primarily Correspondence speeches and printed materials
Material relating to Winston's position as Executive Director of the Valley Development Foundation, Inc. (1959-1966). Includes speeches correspondence and printed materials.

Covers Winston's Career at Cornell as lecturer in the Department of City and Regional Planning (1959-1974) and Director of the Office of Regional Resources and Development (1965-1971). Consists chiefly of studies for urban renewal projects in various central New York communities and publications on planning by various institutions and individuals associated with Cornell. Includes lecture materials, student papers and correspondence.
